item.title: Path and road side kerbs damaged. Originally reported 28/03/25 and now you say this work has been completed and job closed. item.title: Cycle path in poor condition, 12th June
item.description:
Good morning. Please could you look at improving the condition of the cycle path between the railway bridge by Shelburne rd and the lansdown pub. Along this route of approx half a mile, the verge is overgrown, tree roots have severely damaged the tarmac and at various points it has been dug up. In general the cycle path is dangerous and, at points, not wide enough for two cycles to pass. The discomfort experienced in using the path forces cycles and scooters onto the main road, much to the annoyance of many motorists and with a higher chance of serious accidents. Many thanks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 88a, Lansdown Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Trees overhanging the pavement making if difficult to pass, 11th June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 97, Springbank Road, Springbank, Cheltenham

item.title: Sunken man hole cover 400x400x70mm, 11th June
item.description:
Sunken man hole cover, on the A40 travelling westbound. Immediately after passing Dowdeswell reservoir on the left, approximately 150m before the junction on the right for Lower Dowdeswell. Or Alternatively 160m before the Dowdeswell woods car park on the left. As can be seen in the pictures it's approximately 30m before the bus stop lay by on the left.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet
